meanings.definition: The posterior part of the alimentary canal in certain invertebrates.
meanings.sent1: The proctodeums of the insect help in the digestion process.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the proctodeums of invertebrates to understand their digestive systems.
meanings.sent3: The proctodeums of the worm were the topic of the biology class's discussion.
meanings.sent4: In the world of invertebrates, the proctodeums play a crucial role in nutrient absorption.
meanings.sent5: The anatomy book had detailed illustrations of various proctodeums in different invertebrates.

meanings.definition: The terminal part of the hindgut in insects and some other arthropods.
meanings.sent1: After the meal, the food moves to the proctodeums for waste removal.
meanings.sent2: Insects have specialized proctodeums for the final stages of digestion.
meanings.sent3: The ant accidentally dropped its food near the proctodeums, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The proctodeums of the beetle were compared to a waste disposal unit in the ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a model to explain how food travels through the proctodeums of insects.
